review_blob: Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a nice layer of dense white head. Aroma is loaded with funk, citrus, and grass. Taste is lemon citrus, followed by some bitterness, mixed in with some Brett funk. Finishes dry with a bit of an aspirin like aftertaste.

Thanks to Tommy and Pat for sending. Dark muddy brown with a nice layer of white head. Aroma is spices, raisins, and brandy barrel character. Taste is clove, Belgian yeast, raisins and light Brandy sweetness. Wonderful treatment of the base beer, this is very nicely balanced.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Rigor Mortis Abt Brandy

review_blob: Bottle. Thanks to Tommy and Pat for sending me this. Oily black with a nice layer of mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, and barrel character. Taste is light coffee roast and a hint of sweet brandy/cognac. Pretty smooth overall and not nearly as much barrel as I was expecting which isnt necessarily a bad thing. Very good.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Pch Mortel Brandy/Cognac

review_blob: Dense purple with nice legs. Aroma is blackberry, white chocolate, honey and light vinious undertones. Lots of sweetness up front, followed by blackberry acidic tartness, mixed in with some oak. Thick syrupy mouthfeel. Wow, very good, tons of flavour in this, its very sweet but the acid and tartness from the blackberries really brings it together.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2016

Bottle. Southern charred 15. Dark muddy brown with dense white head. Wonderful aroma, oak, vanilla, sweet malts, and spirits. Taste is sweet caramel, toffee, mixed in with bitter hops, followed by vanilla and sprit character. Sticky , bitter sweet finish. The barrel treatment has smoothed out the base beer quite a bit, very good.

Bottle. Thanks to Tom10101 for this one. Appearance is cloudy yellow with straw white head. Aroma is lemon citrus, and Brett funk. Taste is bitter hops up front, followed by light citrus undertones mixed in with some mild hints of funk. Finishes dry, high prickly carbonation. Nicely done.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Dernire Volont Avec des Brettanomyces

review_blob: Bottle. Clear yellow with frothy white head. Aroma is light funk, citrus, and pineapple. Taste is pine, light funk, and citrus. Finishes clean and semi-dry. Interesting, not a lot of Brett character, but refreshing overall.
Clear yellow with light white head. Aroma is light Apple, Belgian yeast, and grass. Taste is light Apple, grains, and yeast. Basic and clean.
beer_name: Four Winds / Le Trou du Diable Exil dEden

review_blob: Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour with light white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, clove, and banana. Taste is clove, tropical fruit, bitter hop presence, yeasty, with a bitter spicy finish. Solid, and very quenching.

Bottle. Clear yellow whit light white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is funky horse dung, apples, and hay. Taste is green apples, lemon tartness, and light funk. Finishes dry and bitter. There is almost zero sweetness to this which gives it a dry clean finish. Really nice, and very interesting.

Bottle. Clear yellow with light white head (good retention). Aroma is Belgian yeast, clove, and lemon. Taste is light sweetness, grass, hint of bitterness, clean finish. Pretty basic, but nothing offensive and very drinkable.

Bottle. Ruby red with pink white head. Aroma is strawberry jam, barnyard funk, vinious undertones, and cherries. Taste is cherries, oak, light sweetness, red wine character, and funk. Finishes semi dry with some light bitterness. Really well balanced, this is pretty awesome.

Bottle. Semi-Cloudy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, and yogurt sourness. Taste is sour yogurt, orange peel, followed by more sourness. Very sour, which leaves no trace of anything else in the taste.
Bottle. Cloudy golden with nice white head. Big fruity aroma with peach, and lactic funk. Taste is bursting with tropical fruit, lactic funk, and citrus. Refreshing and quenching, wow!!
UPDATED: APR 20, 2016
beer_name: Moon Under Water Oud King Crow Sour Dark Ale

review_blob: Can. Copper pour with a nice white head. Aroma citrus, floral undertones and pine. Taste is crisp bitterness, tropical fruit, and pine. Really well executed, this is superb.

Can. Cloudy yellow pour with dense white head. Aroma is pine, light floral undertones, tropical fruit and citrus. Taste is bitter Pine, hints of tropical fruit, light pepper, grass, citrus, with a crisp clean finish. Nice mouthfeel, very crisp and drinkable, solid, really complex and very well balanced. Wow.

Can. Yellow with light white head. Aroma is vanilla latte, mocha, and caramel. Taste is mocha, grains, light vanilla, with a crisp clean finish. Very drinkable, interesting beer, surprised this works so well.

Bottle. 11.5% Abv. Cloudy yellow with dense white head. Aroma is citrus pine, pineapple, with light floral undertones. Taste is bitter pineapples, huge hop resin, with a sticky malt backbone and some heat in the aftertaste. Man, this is big, reminds me of Lawsons triple sunshine a bit. Nice but at 11.5% this is only for small consumption, if I had bought a sixer of this Id be in trouble.

Can. Cloudy yellow with straw white head. Aroma is loads of tropical fruit, pineapple, very juicy smelling. Taste is light bitterness, pine, and tropical fruit. Very good, the aroma for this is pretty unbelievable. Taste wise its a bit boozy and a touch imbalanced, but still darn tasty,
beer_name: Block 15 Sticky Hands IPA #13 - Tropical Slam

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Bottle. Black with dense white head. Aroma is chocolate, minerals, and rich caramel. Taste is bitter hops, minerals, and black liquorice, with an unpleasant mineral like aftertaste. Intersting, I prefer regular Adam though, not a fan of the aftertaste of this.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Adam from the Stone

review_blob: Bottle. Dark brown, with frothy white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, bread, raisins, and spices, very atypical quad aroma. Taste is raisins, caramel, spice, followed by some off flavour (metal vomit). Not great, has a strange medicinal aftertaste, could be a bad bottle I guess.

Bottle. Dated 03-02-16. Appearance is clear yellow with white head. Aroma is loaded with citrusy goodness and tropical fruit, and pine. Taste is light citrus pine, tropical fruits, bitter grassy finish. Excellent treatment for the style, not too malty, lots of citrus character, and very well balanced.

Bottle. Appearance is reddish brown with light white head. Aroma is tons of coffee, mixed in with brown sugar, and light pine. Taste is coffee, pine, sweet malts, with a sticky bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel. Count me in as a big fan of this, the coffee blends effortlessly and cuts the sweetness of the base beer a fair bit, well done.

Bottle. Appearance is dark red with lingering dense white head. Funky aroma, lots of Brett, with hints of oak, vanilla, and some light vinous undertones. Taste is light bitterness, Brett funk, a touch of sweetness, and oak, finishes dry and slightly bitter.  Really interesting beer, lots of biterness and Brett funk, but also very robust in body and taste, Bravo!

Can. Appearance is golden copper with dense white head. Aroma is pine, tropical fruits, and grapefruit. Taste is bitter hop resin, hint of tropical fruits, followed by a semi- sweet malt backbone that finishes medium bitter. Really good, dangerously quaffable for the ABV.

Can. Appearance is light yellow with dense white head. Aroma is peach, mango, pineapple, basically a whirlpool of tropical fruit. Taste is light bitterness up front, followed by grass, towards the middle the tropical fruit shines through mixed in with some light rye spice. Dry quenching finish. Very refreshing beer!
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016

Bottle vintage 2015, sent by Tommy, and shared amongst friends. Appearance is cloudy yellow with plenty of white head. Aroma is lactic funk, acid, and ripe fruit. Taste is a punch of funk, with lemon zest, and refreshing crisp finish. I dont get the plum really but that might be a result of the age of the bottle. Either way this is world class stuff much more lactic funk then I was expecting.

Bottle. With the new label (pictured). Apearance is gold with lively white head. Aroma is lemon cookies, fruity esters, and Belgian yeast. Taste is light bitterness, lemon, and a touch of sweetness. Not bad, very much on par with a tripel in terms of flavour profile.
Bottle. Golden appearance with frothy white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, and light herbal notes. Taste is pine, citrus, with a touch of malty sweetness, finishes medium bitter. Nice IPA.

Can. Sweet. Appearance is cloudy yellow white frothy white head. Aroma is pineapple, lots of pineapple, Did you ever have five alive as a kid? Holy crap does this beer ever remind me of what that smells like. Taste is really juicy, with orange, light pineapple, followed by a crisp lightly bitter finish. Very crushable stuff. iMHO, this kicks ass. Well done!
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Pale Ale Project #2

review_blob: Bottle. Appearance is gold with frothy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, tangerine, lots of tropical fruit. Taste is tropical fruit, and lemon, with a bitter hop finish. Not as enticing as the aroma suggested but still pretty tasty!

Can. Appearance is copper gold with light white head. Aroma is juicy tropical fruit, mangos, peach, and the like. Taste is grass, followed by tropical fruit, with a bitter resinous finish. Very nice, Well done!

Bottle. Vintage 2013. Appearance is muddy brown with light white head. Aroma is oak, rye spice, and pine. Taste is rye spirits, oak, followed by some light bitterness with a semi dry rye spice finish. Not on the same level as the bourbon, this one is very rye forward and its not as smooth and somewhat harsh compared to bourbon version. That being said its aged in rye barrels so I guess it should be both harsher and less smooth then something dropped in a bourbon barrel. Notwithstanding I had this next to the bourbon its still pretty tasty. If you like rye you will dig this.
beer_name: AleSmith Old Numbskull - Rye Barrel Aged

review_blob: Bottle. Vintage 2012 acquired many moons ago, sampled side by side with the rye version. Appearance is dark brown with frothy white head. Aroma is vanilla, brown sugar, and charred oak. Taste is a hint of pine, brown sugar, vanilla and oak. Smooth finish, with no hint of booze. Really nice, lots of barrel character but I still get some nice piney undertones from the base beer.
beer_name: AleSmith Old Numbskull - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Bottle. Vintage 2015. Appearance is black mud with thick mocha head. Aroma is molases, oak, vanilla, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is milk chocolate, fudge, vanilla, coffee, and ash. Really good, sounds like the Abv has varied quite a bit by vintage. Thankfully 2015 is 12.5% (I think), which isnt a week beer by anyone standards but still within the realm of drinkable.
beer_name: Hangar 24 Barrel Roll No. 03: Pugachevs Cobra - Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout

review_blob: Bottle. From pat, thanks buddy. Appearance is black with a shit ton of foam, this is a very lively beer, although once it calms it retains a perfect inch of dense mocha head. Aroma is Brett funk, cola, roasted malts, and red wine. Taste is sour, some light roast, followed by vinous undertones. Finishes a bit dry with some lingering sourness and a touch of heat. Mad tasty.
beer_name: Bellwoods No Rest For The Wicked

review_blob: Bottle. Appearance is light gold with white head. Aroma is brown sugar, tofee, caramel, and spirits. Taste is light bitterness, crackers, finishes bitter with oak, butterscotch and some spirit character. I can see why some people have not enjoyed this. For me, I like whiskey, and for whatever reason I get a lot of the same characteristics here, in that its very oaky and a bit harsh. Very interesting beer.

375 ml bottle from Tommy, thanks man! Appearance is dark purple, with nice legs. Aroma is oak, cherry, honey, and vinious undertones. Tast is cherry, followed by some light tartness and honey sweetness. Finishes somewhat dry with a bit of an oaky aftertaste. This mead is really well balanced, not too sweet or tart/acidic, lives up to the hype!

Had this many times but apparently never rated it. Anyway, 750 ml bottled in January of 2013. Appearance is black with creamy head. Aroma is coffee, brown sugar, and roasted malts. Taste is bitter roast, followed by sweet coffee, dark chocolate, and a bit of sweet port like character. Finishes medium bitter, with a touch of heat. This was the first Baltic potter that I tried when I was first getting into craft beer. Its a great example of the style, and ages really well.
beer_name: Les Trois Mousquetaires G.C. Porter Baltique

review_blob: Bottle. A least a few years old. Appearance is dark black with dense white head. Good lacing and retention. Aroma is anise, some light sourness, mixed in with brown sugar and clove. Taste is stoned fruit, clove, mixed in with a hint of tartness. Really nice beer, had this fresh once and remember it tasting a lot stronger. Tasting really great right now though.

Bottle. Appearance is black with thick mocha head. Aroma chocolate, peanuts, wow, very aromatic, ever have Reeses puffs cereral ? This seems to remind me a lot how that smells. Taste is chocolate, bitter roast, and peanuts. Dry toasty finish. Not bad, not at all sweet like the aroma suggests, nor does it have an artificial taste like I was thinking it might. Cool. I really enjoyed this.

Bottle. About a year old. Pretty cool looking label. Appearance is muddy black with lots of lively white head. Aroma is clove, toffee, and gingerbread. Taste is light spice, bread, warm medium bitter finish. Not bad, just what I felt like, nice amount of spice and agree with the festive feel in the deScription, pretty mellow for a 10 plus beer.

200 ml bottle (vintage 2010) courtesy of Tommy, thanks man. Appearance is liquid gold with nice legs. Aroma is oak, green apple, and honey. Taste is light honey, it really opens up towards the middle with sour apple and more subtle honey sweetness. Full bodied. Extremely well balanced and a faint hint of alcohol. This is delicious!

Bottle. Appearance is black with light mocha head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is anise, dark fruit, and roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, and bitter dark chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Really enjoyed this, more like a RIS than a Baltic as it is more toasty and bitter, then sweet dark fruit, but its really tasty!

Bottle. Black viscous appearance. Thick chocolate covered head with good lasting power, great looking stout. Aroma is dark fruits, ash, and coffee. Taste is roasted malts, burnt brown sugar, with a bitter roast finish. Really well balanced imperial stout, nice amount of complexity without being over the top.

Bottle. Vintage 2013 from Tommy, thanks man! Beautiful appearance; thick black with chocolate milk head and nice lacing. Aroma is ash, oak, vanilla, chocolate, and spirits. Taste is chocolate fudge, ash, oak, and vanilla. Finishes with a bitter coffee like aftertaste and a slight hint of booze. Pretty damn awesome to say the least, wishfull thinking thatll ever try this again so I am going to savour every last sip.
